channel.title: Comments on: Data Visualization webinar (and others)

item.title: By: Julia Kochi
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.content:encoded:
If you’re like me and was wondering how to use those cool customized templates in Excel, Lisa gave me the following information:

  • You can indeed use your own custom palettes in Excel. Here’s a page that discusses how to create a custom palette: http://www.officetooltips.com/excel/tips/how_to_change_the_default_colors_that_excel_uses_for_chart_series.html. It doesn’t mention it on this page, but when you get to the part where you’re selecting colors, click the “More Colors” button, and then select the “Custom” tab. There you can enter colors by RGB code.
